- (void) setWidth: (float)  aWidth   [implementation]

Definition at line 103 of file CPTableColumn.j.

00103                 :(float)aWidth
00104 {
00105     aWidth = +aWidth;
00106 
00107     if (_width === aWidth)
00108         return;
00109 
00110     var newWidth = MIN(MAX(aWidth, [self minWidth]), [self maxWidth]);
00111 
00112     if (_width === newWidth)
00113         return;
00114 
00115     var oldWidth = _width;
00116 
00117     _width = newWidth;
00118 
00119     var tableView = [self tableView];
00120 
00121     if (tableView)
00122     {
00123         var index = [[tableView tableColumns] indexOfObjectIdenticalTo:self],
00124             dirtyTableColumnRangeIndex = tableView._dirtyTableColumnRangeIndex;
00125             
00126         if (dirtyTableColumnRangeIndex < 0)
00127             tableView._dirtyTableColumnRangeIndex = index;
00128         else
00129             tableView._dirtyTableColumnRangeIndex = MIN(index,  tableView._dirtyTableColumnRangeIndex);
00130         
00131         var rows = tableView._exposedRows,
00132             columns = [CPIndexSet indexSetWithIndexesInRange:CPMakeRange(index, [tableView._exposedColumns lastIndex] - index + 1)];        
00133         
00134         // FIXME: Would be faster with some sort of -setNeedsDisplayInColumns: that updates a dirtyTableColumnForDisplay cache; then marked columns would relayout their data views at display time.
00135         [tableView _layoutDataViewsInRows:rows columns:columns];
00136         [tableView tile];
00137         
00138         if (!_disableResizingPosting)
00139             [self _postDidResizeNotificationWithOldWidth:oldWidth];
00140     }
00141 }
